Facebook Youtube Twitch Twitter LinkedIn Custom RTMP Facebook, the world\'s largest social network, has entered the live streaming game. Facebook Live boasts the largest audience globally, great interactive features for audience members, and filters for customizing live streams. The streaming content on Facebook is as diverse as the platform itself; publishers include everyone from average people to world-famous celebrities. With over 1 billion users, YouTube is the biggest video viewing platform in the world. It remains the #1 platform for gamers to watch gaming content worldwide. Twitch is the world’s leading social video platform and community for gamers. +100 million community members visit Twitch monthly to watch and connect with more than 1.7 million broadcasters. This is a platform for real video game enthusiasts. Twitter is the place to see what\'s happening in the world—from breaking news to major live events. You can easily create live videos to share what\'s happening live. LinkedIn — the social network for the working world with close to 600 million users globally. LinkedIn Live focus on streaming things like Q&As, events, conferences, earnings calls, awards ceremonies, product announcements, and more. Allows you to add a Custom RTMP channel for restreaming. https://support.stageten.tv/en/articles/3981648-streaming-to-facebook-via-rtmp https://support.switcherstudio.com/en/articles/3553932-streaming-to-youtube-using-custom-rtmp https://help.pexip.com/service/stream-twitch.htm https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/how-to-use-live-producer#RTMP https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/answer/128901/go-live-using-a-custom-stream-rtmp-?lang=en https://support.restream.io/en/articles/369436-custom-rtmp-channel

Stop Moderating You are currently moderating the broadcast Being a moderator you can kick out members and viewers, reply-to and delete messages. Stopping moderation Manage Moderators
Added to moderator\'s group of broadcast Removed from moderator\'s group of broadcast %1$s has been added to the moderator\'s group of the broadcast by %2$s.\nBeing a moderator one can kick out members and viewers, reply-to and delete messages. %1$s has been removed from the moderator\'s group of the broadcast by %2$s.\nWithout being a moderator one can no longer kick out members and viewers, reply-to and delete messages
